plotscenproj plots a 3D array of data by sau in a single plot

Source: R/comparescenarios.R
plotsceneproj.Rd

plotsceneproj uses a 3D array of years x sau x replicates to produce a plot by sau of those projections all in a single plot. Options exist to include a horizontal dashed line and to include a median line and either 90 or 95 quantiles across the plot.

plotsceneproj(
  rundir,
  inarr,
  glb,
  scene,
  filen = "",
  label = "",
  maxy = 0,
  Q = 90,
  hline = NA
)

Arguments

rundir

the directory in which all results are held for a scenario or comparison of scenarios

inarr

the 3D array of projections for a given scenario derived from catch or cpue or whatever

glb

the global object relating to the particular acenario

scene

the scenario name

filen

the filename in which to store the plot, default="" which draws the plot to the console

label

what is the name of the variable being plotted, default=""

maxy

what constant maximum y-axis to use? default=0 which uss the maximum for each sau

Q

which quantile to use, default = 90. If set to 0 no median or quantiles are plotted, 95 will lead to the 95 percent quantiles being plotted

hline

should a horizontal dashed line be included. default=NA, which means that no line is added. Otherwise whichever value is given this argument will lead to a dashed horizontal black line of width 1.

Value

invisibly a list of the quantiles for each sau

Examples

print("wait on data sets")
#> [1] "wait on data sets"
#  rundir=rundir; inarr=cdivmsy[[1]];glb=glbc[[1]];scenes=scenes[1];
#  filen="";label="Catch / MSY";maxy=0
